author: Special Correspondent
text:
Trupti Desai with her supporters at Nandurshingote, about 50 km from Nashik, on Monday.— PHOTO: PTI

Rangaragini Bhumata Brigade (RBB) leader Trupti Desai was apprehended yet again by the Maharashtra police as she offered prayers at the Trimbakeshwar temple in Nashik on Friday.

The RBB, which has vowed to fight gender barriers in the State’s temples, was in the news after its much-publicised but unsuccessful attempt to breach the inner sanctum of the Shani Shingnapur temple in Ahmednagar district on Republic Day this year.

Undeterred, Ms Desai tried but failed yet again when the police stopped RBB activists from entering the Trimbakeshwar temple in Nashik on Mahashivratri earlier this month.

“We offered prayers to Lord Shiva at Trimbakeshwar temple and prayed that women be allowed into the temple’s inner sanctum. The fact that we could enter the temple is a very big thing in itself,” she said later.

However, local women have not taken kindly to the RBB’s campaign, calling it “sacrilegious”.

To prevent any untoward incident, the local police detained RBB activists immediately after they finished their prayers. The RBB had been announcing its intention to enter the temple’s inner sanctum all month.
